sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: He reminisced about spending his time with Anna a lot here when they were still kids. Chloe walks into the library and finds Will.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: I have a feeling I'd find you here.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: She talks about how close he is to Anna and always spending time here even though he is not really a fan of reading but will still stay and read here with Anna.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: But. . . Why are you here?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: You're coming back here. Even though knowing her, she wants you to move on. . .

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: You're here. She won't be happy if she knows that you're here, this far back.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Then what should I do? Forget everything?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: Of course not.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Then what? Up until now, we've always been together. If I forget now... Then we're no longer together.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: And everything that has ever happened will lose its meaning. But if I don't... I will just be here. Standing still.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: No one is telling you to forget, but what would she think if she sees you like this?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: I know that the two of you complete one another. There's you and there's Anna.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: If you stop walking, she'll always drag you forward.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: If she stopped running, you'll always carry her on your back.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: However now, there's only one left of the two of you.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: If one of you stopped walking, stopped running... can't be dragged, can't be carried on your back... do you have to stop?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: If you stop and wait, will she stand up and start to walk again with you?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: That's why she would want you to keep on walking. To move onwards Will. . . moving onwards does not mean to forget.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: It’s about learning to live a full and happy life even as you miss and long for what we have lost.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: It’s about remembering and honoring the one we loved while also embracing the beauty and fullness of the life we still get to live.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: We move forward with life, embracing the fullness of it, even as our loss becomes part of who we now are.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: However, words are just words. Without a heart to accept it, what came out of Chloe's mouth will just be a series of sounds.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Nothing will change. Everything will be the same. However for Will, tomorrow won't be the same.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Can I really move onwards without her?

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Tomorrow will change.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Even though my heart ache so much thinking about her.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Tomorrow will always change.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Even now i still wish she would welcome me home in that apartment.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: And everything will always change. Whether Anna, Chloe, or anyone in his life are still a part of his life or not.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: I know it is difficult Will, but you are not alone. There are people who cherish you.

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: Try to see what you still have rather than what you don’t. I’m sure she’s not happy seeing you blaming yourself like this.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Because as someone who has always been there for someone, as someone who always has someone that will be there for him, and as someone who's forced to stand alone in his own journey... from now... until some far unknown future...

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: What should I do?

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: I am not sure Will . . .

sentences.name: Chloe
sentences.sentence: But I know for sure that you should not hide anymore. And maybe. . . maybe then you will find your answer.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: The conversation with Chloe encourages Will to go back to his apartment for the first time since the night Anna died.
